title: Olive and basil chicken
description: A fresh herb sauce transforms a weeknight supper - light, tasty, and simple to make
supplementary: A herby sauce enlivens humble chicken. Serve with extra-creamy garlic mash, load up a tray, and head for the sofa.
instructions: Trim the chicken breasts of any fat and the mini fillets flaps.
Place each breast between two sheets of cling film and gently beat with a rolling pin until half their thickness. Place in a shallow bowl.
Mix 7tbsp olive oil with the lemon zest and half the garlic. Add the chicken.
Season with black pepper, then cover and chill.
Place the remaining garlic, olives, and basil into a blender. Add the lemon juice and the remaining oil. Blend until smooth and season to taste.
Preheat a griddle or non-stick pan over a medium heat. Cook the chicken for 8 minutes, turning halfway through.
Spoon the sauce over each chicken breast and serve over mash.
imageDesc: A golden, griddled chicken breast on a ceramic plate, with a thick herb sauce generously laid over the top.
